intro: Blepharodon cuatrecasasii, commonly known as the Cuatrecasas' blepharodon, is a rare and endemic flowering plant species. It belongs to the family Arecaceae, which includes palms, and is characterized by its unique leaf structure and growth habit. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in mountainous regions with rich, well-drained soil. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in axillary positions, and it produces dark, spherical fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
